turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: It's not something for nothing, George, I took you in on this, you have to go.  That's your thing. I've made the deal with Graff.  I can't go.  I can't go in, I've spoken on this too much.  I've got a big mouth.  "The fucking leads" et cetera, blah blah blah "...the fucking tight ass company..."

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: They'll know when you go over to Graff...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: What will they know?  That I stole the leads?  I didn't steal the leads, I'm going to the movies tonight with a friend, and then I'm going to the Como Inn.  Why did I go to Graff?  I got a better deal. Period.  Let 'em prove something. They can't prove anything that's not the case.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: You want me to break into the office tonight and steal the leads?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Listen to this.  I have an alibi, I'm going to the Como Inn, why? Why?  The place gets robbed, they're going to come looking for me.  Why?  Because I probably did it.  Are you going to turn me in?  George?  Are you going to turn me in?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: What if you don't get caught?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: They come to you, you going to turn me in?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Why would they come to me?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: They're going to come to everyone.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You wouldn't, George, that's why I'm talking to you.  Answer me. They come to you.  You going to turn me in?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Then listen to this: I have to get those leads tonight.  That's something I have to do.  If I'm not at the movies...if I'm not eating over at the inn...If you don't do this, then I have to come in here...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: ...I thought that we were only talking...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...they take me, then.  They're going to ask me who were my accomplices.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Well, to the law, you're an accessory.  Before the fact.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Then tough luck, George, because you are.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Why?  Why, because you only told me about it?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me, Dave. Why are you talking this way to me? I don't understand.  Why are you doing this at all...?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: That's none of your fucking business...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Well, well, well, talk to me, we sat down to eat dinner, and here I'm a criminal...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Why?  Why you going to give me five grand?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Is that what I just said?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: You need money?  Is that the...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Hey, hey, let's just keep it simple, what I need is not the...what do you need...?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: What is the five grand?  What is the, you said that we were going to split five...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I lied.  Alright?  My end is my business. Your end's twenty-five.  In or out. You tell me, you're out you take the consequences.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: If anyone's going, I could use some coffee.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: I, you know, they should be insured.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Then, you know, they wouldn't be so ups...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Yeah.  That's swell.  Yes.  You're right.  How are you?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: I'm fine.  You mean the board?  You mean the board...?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: I'm, I'm, I'm, I'm fucked on the board.  You.  You see how...I...  I can't...my mind must be in other places. 'Cause I can't do any...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: What?  You can't do any what?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Well, they're old.  I saw the shit that they were giving you.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: That's not...Fuck that shit, George. You're a, hey, you had a bad month. You're a good man, George.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: You hit a bad streak.  We've all... look at this: fifteen units Mountain View, the fucking things get stole.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: He filed half of them, he filed the big one.  All the little ones, I have, I have to go back and...ah, fuck, I got to go out like a fucking schmuck hat in my hand and reclose the...  I mean, talk about a bad streak. That would sap anyone's self confi... I got to go out and reclose all my... Where's the phones?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: What.  What kind of outfit are we running where...where anyone...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Where criminals can come in here... they take the...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: They stole the phones.  They stole the leads.  They're...Christ.  What am I going to do this month? Oh, shit...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: You think they're going to catch... where are you going?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: ...what am I going to do all month...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: He said we're all going to have to go talk to the guy.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Yeah.  That's swell.  Another waste of time.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Why? 'Cause they aren't going to find the guy.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Why?  Because they're stupid. "Where were you last night..."

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: I was at home, where were you?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: See...?  Were you the guy who broke in?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Then don't sweat it, George, you know why?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: When I talk to the police, I get nervous.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Uh, uh, did he go to the restaurant?  I...I...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Do you understand?  My stuff is mine, his stuff is ours.  I'm taking half of his commissions-- now, you work it out.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Did the leads come in yet?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Oh, God, I hate this job.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Read it.  Bruce and Harriett Nyborg.  What happened here?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Fuck.  I had them on River Glen.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: ...how can you talk to me that... that...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Rick, I'm going to flag a cab.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: I, um, and may...maybe they're in... they're in...you should, John, if we're ins...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: I'm sure that we're insured, George...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: 'Cause, you know, 'cause they weren't, I know that Mitch and Murray uh...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: That they're going to be upset.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: That's right.  You want to go out today...?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: I didn't...why should I..."Where were you last..." Is anybody listening to me...?  Where's Moss...?  Where...?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: ...Come in here...I work here, I don't come in here to be mistreated...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: I want to work today, that's why I came...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: The leads come in, I'll let...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: ...that's why I came in.  I thought I...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: I don't want to go to lunch.

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Where does he get off to talk that way to a working man?  It's not...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Will you take it outside, we have people trying to do business here...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: That's what, that's what, that's what I was trying to do.  That's why I came in...I meet gestapo tac...

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: I meet gestapo tactics...I meet gestapo tactics...That's not right... No man has the right to..."Call an attorney," that means you're guilt... you're under sus..."Co...," he says, "cooperate" or we'll go downtown.  That's not...as long as I've...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Will you get out of here.  Will you get out of here.  Will you.  I'm trying to run an office here.  Will you go to lunch?  Go to lunch. Will you go to lunch?

turns.speaker: AARONOW
turns.text: Did they find the guy who broke into the office yet?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Don't fuck with me, fella.  I'm talking about a fuckin' Cadillac car that you owe me...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Oh, fuck.  Fuck.  FUCK FUCK FUCK!  WILLIAMSON!!! WILLIAMSON!!!  OPEN THE FUCKING...WILLIAMSON...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Who told me wh...?  You've got a fuckin', you've...a...who is this...?  You've got a board-up on the window...Moss told me.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: How the fuck do I know?  What...talk to me.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: And I don't want any fucking shit and I don't give a shit, Lingk puts me over the top, you filed it, that's fine, any other shit kicks out you go back.  You...you reclose it, 'cause I closed it and you...you owe me the car.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Fuck insured.  You owe me a car.

turns.speaker: BAYLEN
turns.text: Please don't leave.  I'm going to talk to you.  What's your name?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: They took the typewriters, they took the leads, they took the cash, they took the contracts...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Listen to me, the statute, it's for your protection.  I have no complaints with that, in fact, I was a member of the board when we drafted it, so quite the opposite. It says that you can change your mind three working days from the time the deal is closed.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Which, wait a second, which is not until the check is cashed.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: I've...look.  Will someone get this guy off my back.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Yes, I have a problem.  Yes, I do, my fr...It's not me that ripped the joint off, I'm doing business. I'll be with you in a while.  You got it...?  Where are you going?

turns.speaker: BAYLEN
turns.text: Roma, would you, I'd like to get some lunch...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: I'm talking with Mr. Lingk.  If you please, I'll be back in.  I'll be back in a while...I told you, check with Mr. Williamson.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: You call them again.  Mr. Williamson...!

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: You stupid fucking cunt.  You, Williamson...I'm talking to you, shithead...You just cost me six thousand dollars.  Six thousand dollars.  And one Cadillac.  That's right.  What are you going to do about it?  What are you goin to do about it, asshole. You fucking shit.  Where did you learn your trade.  You stupid fucking cunt.  You idiot.  Whoever told you you could work with men?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: I'm going to have your job, shithead. I'm going downtown and talk to Mitch and Murrray, and I'm going to Lemkin.  I don't care whose nephew you are, who you know, whose dick you're sucking on.  You're going out, I swear to you, you're going...

turns.speaker: BAYLEN
turns.text: Hey, fella, let's get this done...

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Anyone in this office lives on their wits...  I'm going to be with you in a second.  What you're hired for is to help us--does that seem clear to you?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: You're done, come down, and let's...

turns.speaker: BAYLEN
turns.text: Would you come in here, please?

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: And let's put this together.  Okay? Shel?  Say okay.

turns.speaker: BAYLEN
turns.text: Mr. Levene, I think we have to talk.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: I'm going to the Chinks.  You're done, come down, we're going to smoke a cigarette.

turns.speaker: ROMA
turns.text: Hey, hey, hey, easy friend.  That's the "Machine." That is Shelly "The Machine" Lev...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: John...John...John.  Okay.  John. John.  Look:  The Glengarry Highland's leads, you're sending Roma out.  Fine. He's a good man.  We know what he is.  He's fine.  All I'm saying, you look at the board, he's throwing...wait, wait, wait, he's throwing them away, he's throwing the leads away.  All that I'm saying, that you're wasting leads. I don't want to tell you your job. All that I'm saying, things get set, I know they do, you get a certain mindset... A guy gets a reputation.  We know how this...all I'm saying, put a closer on the job. There's more than one man for the... Put a...wait a second, put a proven man out...and you watch, now wait a second--and you watch your dollar volumes...You start closing them for fifty 'stead of twenty- five...you put a closer on the...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: No.  John.  No.  Let's wait, let's back up here, I did...will you please?  Wait a second.  Please.  I didn't "blow" them.  No.  I didn't "blow" them.  No.  One kicked out, one I closed...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: ...I, if you'd listen to me. Please.  I closed the cocksucker. His ex, John, his ex, I didn't know he was married...he, the judge invalidated the...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: ...and what is that, John?  What? Bad luck.  That's all it is.  I pray in your life you will never find it runs in streaks.  That's what it does, that's all it's doing. Streaks.  I pray it misses you. That's all I want to say.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Four.  You had four leads.  One kicked out, one the judge, you say...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: ...you want to see the court records?  John?  Eh?  You want to go down...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: ...then what is this "you say" shit, what is that?  What is that...?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: What is this "you say"?  A deal kicks out...I got to eat.  Shit, Williamson, shit.  You...Moss... Roma...look at the sheets...look at the sheets.  Nineteen eighty, eighty-one...eighty-two...six months of eighty-two...who's there? Who's up there?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Bullshit.  John.  Bullshit.  April, September 1981.  It's me.  It isn't fucking Moss.  Due respect, he's an order taker, John.  He talks, he talks a good game, look at the board, and it's me, John, it's me...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Lately kiss my ass lately.  That isn't how you build an org...talk, talk to Murray.  Talk to Mitch. When we were on Peterson, who paid for his fucking car?  You talk to him.  The Seville...?  He came in, "You bought that for me Shelly." Out of what?  Cold calling.  Nothing. Sixty-five, when we were there, with Glen Ross Farms?  You call 'em downtown.  What was that?  Luck? That was "luck"?  Bullshit, John. You're burning my ass, I can't get a fucking lead...you think that was luck.  My stats for those years? Bullshit...over that period of time...?  Bullshit.  It wasn't luck. It was skill.  You want to throw that away, John...?  You want to throw that away?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: ...it isn't you...?  Who is it? Who is this I'm talking to?  I need the leads...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Bullshit the thirtieth, I don't get on the board the thirtieth, they're going to can my ass.  I need the leads.  I need them now.  Or I'm gone, and you're going to miss me, John, I swear to you.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: I have.  And my job is to marshal those leads...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Marshal the leads...marshal the leads?  What the fuck, what bus did you get off of, we're here to fucking sell.  Fuck marshaling the leads.  What the fuck talk is that? What the fuck talk is that?  Where did you learn that?  In school?  That's "talk," my friend, that's "talk." Our job is to sell.  I'm the man to sell.  I'm getting garbage.  You're giving it to me, and what I'm saying is it's fucked.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Yes.  I am.  I'm sorry to antagonize you.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: ...and I'm going to get bounced and you're...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Let me tell you something, Shelly. I do what I'm hired to do. I'm...wait a second.  I'm hired to watch the leads.  I'm given...hold on, I'm given a policy.  My job is to do that.  What I'm told.  That's it.  You, wait a second, anybody falls below a certain mark I'm not permitted to give them the premium leads.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Then how do they come up above that mark?  With dreck...?  That's nonsense.  Explain this to me. 'Cause it's a waste, and it's a stupid waste.  I want to tell you something...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: You know what those leads cost?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: The premium leads.  Yes.  I know what they cost.  John.  Because I, I generated the dollar revenue sufficient to buy them.  Nineteen senny-nine, you know what I made? Senny-nine?  Ninety-six thousand dollars.  John?  For Murray... For Mitch...look at the sheets...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Fuck him.  Fuck Murray.  John?  You know?  You tell him I said so. What does he fucking know?  He's going to have a "sales" contest...you know what our sales contest used to be?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Money.  A fortune.  Money lying on the ground.  Murray?  When was the last time he went out on a sit? Sales contest?  It's laughable. It's cold out there now, John. It's tight.  Money is tight.  This ain't sixty-five.  It ain't.  It just ain't.  See?  See?  Now, I'm a good man--but I need a...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Will you please wait a second. Shelly.  Please.  Murray told me: the hot leads...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: The...Shelly?  The hot leads are assigned according to the board.  During the contest. Period.  Anyone who beats fifty per...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: That's fucked.  That's fucked.  You don't look at the fucking percentage. You look at the gross.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I'll tell you why I'm out.  I'm out, you're giving me toilet paper. John.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I've seen those leads.  I saw them when I was at Homestead, we pitched those cocksuckers Rio Rancho nineteen sixty-nine they wouldn't buy.  They couldn't buy a fucking toaster.  They're broke, John. They're cold.  They're deadbeats, you can't judge on that.  Even so. Even so.  Alright.  Fine.  Fine. Even so.  I go in, FOUR FUCKING LEADS they got their money in a sock.  They're fucking Polacks, John.  Four leads.  I close two. Two.  Fifty per...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: They all kick out.  You run in streaks, pal.  Streaks.  I'm... I'm...don't look at the board, look at me.  Shelly Levene.  Anyone. Ask them on Western.  Ask Getz at Homestead.  Go ask Jerry Graff. You know who I am...I NEED A SHOT. I got to get on the fucking board. Ask them.  Ask them.  Ask them who ever picked up a check I was flush. Moss, Jerry Graff, Mitch himself...Those guys lived on the business I brought in.  They lived on it...and so did Murray, John. You were here you'd of benefited from it too.  And now I'm saying this.  Do I want charity?  Do I want pity?  I want sits.  I want leads that don't come right out of a phone book.  Give me a lead hotter than that, I'll go in and close it.  Give me a chance. That's all I want.  I'm going to get up on that fucking board and all I want is a chance.  It's a streak and I'm going to turn it around.  I need your help.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Bullshit, bullshit, you assign them... What are you telling me?

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: ...apart from the top men on the contest board.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Then put me on the board.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: You start closing again, you'll be on the board.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I can't close these leads, John. No one can.  It's a joke.  John, look, just give me a hot lead. Just give me two of the premium leads.  As a "test," alright?  As a "test" and I promise you...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: And what if you don't close.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: What if you don't?  Then I'm fucked. You see...?  Then it's my job. That's what I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I will close.  John, John, ten percent.  I can get hot.  You know that...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Fuck that.  That's defeatist.  Fuck that.  Fuck it...Get on my side. Go with me.  Let's do something. You want to run this office, run it.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: John.  Listen.  I want to talk to you. Permit me to do this a second.  I'm older than you.  A man acquires a reputation.  On the street.  What he does when he's up, what he does otherwise...I said "ten," you said "no." You said "twenty." I said "fine," I'm not going to fuck with you, how can I beat that, you tell me?...Okay.  Okay.  We'll...Okay. Fine.  We'll...Alright, twenty percent, and fifty bucks a lead. That's fine.  For now.  That's fine. A month or two we'll talk.  A month from now.  Next month.  After the thirtieth.  We'll talk.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: What are we going to say?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: No.  You're right.  That's for later.  We'll talk in a month. What have you got?  I want two sits. Tonight.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: I'm not sure I have two.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I saw the board.  You've got four...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: I've got Roma.  Then I've got Moss...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Bullshit.  They ain't been in the office yet.  Give 'em some stiff. We have a deal or not?  Eh?  Two sits.  The Des Plaines.  Both of 'em, six and ten, you can do it...six and ten...eight and eleven, I don't give a shit, you set 'em up?  Alright?  The two sits in Des Plaines.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: You fucking asshole.  I haven't got it.  I haven't got it, John.  I'll pay you tomorrow.  I'm coming in here with the sales, I'll pay you tomorrow.  I haven't got it, when I pay, the gas...I get back the hotel, I'll bring it in tomorrow.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I'll give you thirty on them now, I'll bring the rest tomorrow.  I've got it at the hotel.  John?  We do that, for chrissake?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I'm asking you.  As a favor to me?  John.  John: my daughter...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Well, I want to tell you something, fella, wasn't long I could pick up the phone, call Murray and I'd have your job.  You know that?  Not too long ago.  For what?  For nothing. "Mur, this new kid burns my ass." "Shelly, he's out." You're gone before I'm back from lunch.  I bought him a trip to Bermuda once...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Wait.  Alright.  Fine.  The one.  Give me the lead.  Give me the one lead.  The best one you have.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Is that it?  Is that it?  You want to do business that way...?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: You want to do business that way...? Alright.  Alright.  Alright. Alright.  What is there on the other list...?

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: You want something off the B list?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: That's what I'm saying.  Yeah.  I'd like something off the other list.  Which, very least, that I'm entitled to.  If I'm still working here, which for the moment I guess that I am.  What?  I'm sorry I spoke harshly to you.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: The deal still stands, our other thing.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Ah, fuck.  Leads!  Leads! Williamson!  Send me out!  Send me out!

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: I talked to Murray and Mitch an hour ago.  They're coming in, you understand they're a bit upset over this morning's...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: How could I tell 'em your sale?  Eh? I don't have a tel...I'll tell 'em your sale when they bring in the leads.  Alright?  Shelly.  Alright? We had a little... You closed a deal.  You made a good sale.  Fine.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: It's better than a good sale.  It's a...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Look: I have a lot of things on my mind, they're coming in, alright, they're very upset, I'm trying to make some sense...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: All that I'm telling you: that one thing you can tell them it's a remarkable sale.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: The only thing remarkable is who you made it to.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: That if the sale sticks, it will be a miracle.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Why should the sale not stick? Hey, fuck you.  That's what I'm saying.  You have no idea of your job.  A man's his job and you're fucked at yours.  You hear what I'm saying to you?  Your "end of month board..." You can't run an office. I don't care.  You don't know what it is, you don't have the sense, you don't have the balls.  You ever been on a sit?  Ever?  Has this cocksucker ever been...you ever sit down with a cust...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: I were you, I'd calm down, Shelly.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Would you?  Would you...?  Or you're gonna what, fire me?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: On an eighty-thousand dollar day? And it ain't even noon.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: You can't think on your feet you should keep your mouth closed.  You hear me?  I'm talking to you. Do you hear me...?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: You can't learn that in an office. Eh?  He's right.  You have to learn it on the streets.  You can't buy that.  You have to live it.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Yes.  Mmm.  Yes.  Precisely. Precisely. 'Cause your partner depends on it.  I'm talking to you, I'm trying to tell you something.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: What are you trying to tell me?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: What Roma's trying to tell you. What I told you yesterday.  Why you don't belong in this business.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: You listen to me, someday you might say, "Hey..." No, fuck that, you just listen what I'm going to say: your partner depends on you.  Your partner...a man who's your "partner" depends on you...you have to go with him and for him...or you're shit, you're shit, you can't exist alone...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: ...excuse me, nothing, you be as cold as you want, but you just fucked a good man out of six thousand dollars and his goddamn bonus 'cause you didn't know the shot, if you can do that and you aren't man enough that it gets you, then I don't know what, if you can't take some thing from that...  you're scum, you're fucking white- bread.  You be as cold as you want. A child would know it, he's right.  You're going to make something up, be sure it will help or keep your mouth closed.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: How do you know I made it up?

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: How do you know I made it up?

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: You said, "You don't make something up unless it's sure to help."  How did you know that I made it up?

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: I told the customer that his contracts had gone to the bank.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Don't fuck with me, John, don't fuck with me...what are you saying?

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Well, I'm saying this, Shel: usually I take the contracts to the bank.  Last night I didn't.  How did you know that?  One night in a year I left a contract on my desk. Nobody knew that but you.  Now how did you know that?  You want to talk to me, you want to talk to someone else...because this is my job.  This is my job on the line, and you are going to talk to me.  Now how did you know that contract was on my desk?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Sure!  I robbed the office.  Sure.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: What'd you do with the leads?  You want to go in there?  I tell him what I know, he's going to dig up something...You got an alibi last night?  You better have one. What did you do with the leads?  If you tell me what you did with the leads, we can talk.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I don't know what you are saying.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: If you tell me where the leads are, I won't turn you in.  If you don't, I am going to tell the cop you stole them, Mitch and Murray will see that you go to jail.  Believe me they will.  Now, what did you do with the leads?  I'm walking in that door--you have five seconds to tell me: or you are going to jail.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I sold them to Jerry Graff.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: How much did you get for them?  How much did you get for them?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Do I have to tell you?  Moss.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I...I'm sure he got more than the five, actually.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: He told me my share was twenty-five.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Okay: I...look: I'm going to make it worth your while.  I am.  I turned this thing around.  I closed the old stuff, I can do it again. I'm the one's going to close 'em. I am!  I am! 'Cause I turned this thing a...I can do that, I can do anyth...last night.  I'm going to tell you, I was ready to Do the Dutch.  Moss gets me, "Do this, we'll get well..." Why not.  Big fuckin' deal.  I'm halfway hoping to get caught.  To put me out of my...  But it taught me something.  What it taught me, that you've got to get out there.  Big deal.  So I wasn't cut out to be a thief.  I was cut out to be a salesman.  And now I'm back, and I got my balls back...and, you know, John, you have the advantage on me now: Whatever it takes to make it right, we'll make it right.  We're going to make it right.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: I want to tell you something, Shelly.  You have a big mouth.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: You've got a big mouth, and now I'm going to show you an even bigger one.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Wait...uh, look...  Look, twelve, twenty, two, twen... twenty-five hundred, it's...take it.  Take it all...  Take it!

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: No, I don't think so, Shel.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: No, I think I don't want your money. I think you fucked up my office. And I think you're going away.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I...what?  Are you, are you, that's why...?  Are you nuts?  I'm...I'm going to close for you, I'm going to...  Here, here, I'm going to make this office...I'm going to be back there Number One...Hey, hey, hey!  This is only the beginning...List...list... listen. Listen.  Just one moment. List...here's what...here's what we're going to do.  Twenty percent. I'm going to give you twenty percent of my sales...  Twenty percent.  For as long as I am with the firm.  Fifty percent.  You're going to be my partner.  Fifty percent.  Of all my sales.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: What sales...?  I just closed eighty-two grand...Are you fuckin'...I'm back...I'm back, this is only the beginning.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Where have you been, Shelly?  Bruce and Harriet Nyborg.  Do you want to see the memos...?  They're nuts... they used to call in every week. When I was with Webb.  And we were selling Arizona...they're nuts...did you see how they were living?  How can you delude yours...

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Forget it.  Frame it.  It's worthless.

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: You stick around I'll pull the memo for you.  I'm busy now...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Their check's no good?  They're nuts...?

turns.speaker: WILLIAMSON
turns.text: Call up the bank.  I called them.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: My ass.  I told 'em.  Listen to this: I said...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Hey, I don't want to hear your fucking war stories...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Give me some leads.  I'm going out... I'm getting out of...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Na, fuck the leads, I'm going home.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Hey, they're fuckin' garbage any case...This whole goddamn...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: "...You look around, you say, 'This one has so-and-so, and I have nothing..."

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: "'Why?  Why don't I get the opportunities...?"

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: And did they steal the contracts...?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...the fuck is that supposed to mean...?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Will you shut up, I'm telling you this...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Fuck is that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: "You do get the opportunity...You get them.  As I do, as anyone does..."

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Ricky?...That I don't care they stole the contracts?

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: I got 'em in the kitchen.  I'm eating her crumb cake.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Rick.  Let me tell you.  Wait, we're in the...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Shut the fuck up.  Ricky.  You have a mean streak in you...  And what the fuck are you babbling about...?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...Shut up.  Decide who should be dealt with how?  Is that the thing? I come into the fuckin' office today, I get humiliated by some jagoff cop.  I get accused of...I get this shit thrown in my face by you, you geniune shit, because you're top name on the board...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Get the chalk.  Get the chalk...get the chalk!  I closed 'em!  I closed the cocksucker.  Get the chalk and put me on the board.  I'm going to Hawaii!  Put me on the Cadillac board, Williamson!  Pick up the fuckin' chalk.  Eight units. Mountain View...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: You bet your ass.  Who wants to go to lunch?  Who wants to go to lunch? I'm buying.  Eighty-two fucking grand.  And twelve grand in commission.  John.  On fucking deadbeat magazine subscription leads.

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Hey, big fucking deal.  Broke a bad streak...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: Williamson, get on the phone, call Mitch...

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: "You have to believe in yourself... you"--look--"alright...?"

turns.speaker: LEVENE
turns.text: "I want to tell you something, Harriet..."
